data.text: @tim_blackwell @mrpford Attacking people over the internet is so easy these days, not like the old days where you had to ring a radio show and blast them. Shameful really. Love that bants on your show though 😂
@mrpford You should see the tweets we get during a show...!
@mrpford @abcnews Very good point. It’s hard though when feedback is part of a show.

@meadea @mrpford @abcnews It’s bullying. It’s abuse. It’s just like bigotry and should be treated the same. The tweeters/callers are all ‘heroes when anonymous, but they are cowards, not only here but to all presenters they abuse. Prosecute them as we should bigots.
@BernardZuel @mrpford @abcnews They say “there’s a lot of texts we can’t read out on a family show” 😤

@meadea @mrpford @abcnews What's more, the ABC model, from sport to lifestyle and regular programs, is to encourage online responses by repeating/quoting them, so avoiding that commentary is impossible.
@mrpford @abcnews Good point. But this was a segment calling for people to send text messages
